results.title: Atlantic link
results.creator_credit: Jack Greenwood and Film Producers Guild
results.brief_description: This film traces the laying of the first transatlantic submarine telephone cable, made possible by the cooperation of technologists and engineers in the United Kingdom, the United States and Canada. Describes the routing of landlines on both sides of the Atlantic; the drama and precision involved in the laying of cables between Britain and Newfoundland.
results.description: This film traces the laying of the first transatlantic submarine telephone cable, made possible by the cooperation of technologists and engineers in the United Kingdom, the United States and Canada. results.title: Athlete: hurdles
results.creator_credit: John Rickword, John Dobson and BBC-TV
results.brief_description: Members of the Great Britain Olympic Squad of 1972 demonstrate the techniques of hurdling, then young athletes practise these techniques. Illustrates the analysis and correction of common faults.

results.title: At your service
results.brief_description: This film demonstrates the process of the manufacture of ball bearings by the famous Swedish firm of S.K.F. The firm has its own mines and steel works and carries the manufacturing processes right through to the finished product. For commercial uses some 8,000 different types and sizes are produced, in addition special precision ball bearings with an accuracy to 1,000,000 in. are produced for use in precision instruments.

results.title: At the turn of the age: Hans Holbein the younger 1497-1543
results.creator_credit: Herbert E. Meyer, Walter Leckebusch and Filmstudio Walter Leckebusch
results.brief_description: Deals with aspects of the Renaissance and concentrates on the development of Holbein’s painting, drawing and etching. Holbein, a court painter, and a prime example of the new breed of man who could move out of the restrictive boundaries of his homeland to achieve fame and wealth in foreign courts and cities.

results.title: At the sign of the owl
results.creator_credit: Colin Dean, R. Maslyn Williams, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Herschells Films
results.brief_description: Surveys the activities of the Council of Adult Education in organising cultural activities throughout Victoria, showing particularly the annual Summer School conducted at Albury. The school extends over ten days and provides opportunities for the study of art and crafts, music, opera and drama.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Colin Dean, R. Maslyn Williams, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Herschells Films

results.title: At the Land's End: the Wilson's Promontory National Park
results.creator_credit: David Swift, Parks Victoria, State Film Centre of Victoria and Wilson's Promontory Committee of Management
results.brief_description: This film shows the breathtaking landscape, the wildlife and the facilities for holiday-makers at Tidal River. The work of the ranger is described and there are two outstanding sequences dealing with the Smoking Cliffs at Darby River and gannets diving off Five-Mile Beach. Narrated by Wynn Roberts.

results.title: At the crossroads: the story of America's endangered species
results.creator_credit: Mark Stouffer, Marty Stouffer and Stouffer Productions
results.brief_description: Much of America’s wildlife is now endangered because of hunting, trapping, poisoning, habitat destruction and environmental pollution. America’s extinct mammals and birds include the Gull Island Vole, the Plains Wolf, the Sea Mink, the Labrador Duck and the Great Auk. the Whooping Crane are a dramatic example of an endangered species which came back form the brink of extinction. A simple alternative is offered and some important reasons why these endangered species are vitally important to all life on Earth are presented. Includes footage of the Ivory-billed Woodpecker which was last filmed in 1935 and is probably now extinct. Narrated by Barton Heyman.

results.title: At long last
results.creator_credit: John Ralph, Dennis Sawyer and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A guided tour through the interior and behind the scenes of the new National Library of Canada in Ottawa showing modern devices for information storage and retrieval - teletype, computers, microfilm and an exhaustive card catalogue.

results.title: Assistance India : people to people
results.brief_description: This film shows the organization of Community Aid Abroad and the work it does in under-developed countries, particularly India. Enlightened agricultural and irrigation production; a co-operative rural bank has relieved some financial pressures; and education programmes have given hope for the future. Shows the growth of a self supporting leper community. However despite development, traditional Indian cultural pursuits are strongly perpetuated. No other credits available.
